text: Rottweil () is the oldest town in the German state of Baden-Württemberg. It has almost 25,000 inhabitants as of 2015. The Rottweiler dog breed is named after this town. In 2015, the company ThyssenKrupp started to build a 807-foot (246 m) tower for $45 million in Rottweil. The tower was completed in 2017. It was the tallest elevator test tower in the world when it was finished. ==Twin towns – sister cities== Rottweil is twinned with: * L'Aquila, Italy * Brugg, Switzerland * Hyères, France * Imst, Austria ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:Cities in Baden-Württemberg Category:City-states Category:Former principalities Category:Former republics Category:History of Switzerland Category:Imperial free cities Category:Municipalities in Baden-Württemberg Category:States of the Holy Roman Empire Category:Towns in Baden-Württemberg Category:Württemberg Category:Rottweil (district)
title: Rottweil
